23-041CP.summary: Recommendation to approve the minutes of the Citizen Police Complaint Commission Regular Meeting of Thursday, September 14, 2023.Page 1 of 6411 W. OCEAN BOULEVARDCIVIC CHAMBERS, 5:30 PMWEDNESDAY, OCTOBER 18, 2023CITY OF LONG BEACHCITIZEN POLICE COMPLAINT COMMISSION MINUTESA motion was made by Commissioner McNinch, seconded by Commissioner Garcia, to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 8 - Desmond Fletcher, Veronica Garcia, David Ochoa, Dianne McNinch, Kenneth Shiozaki-Kawamoto, Rocio Torres, Brent Walmsley and Michael SotoAbsent: 3 - Michele Anderson, Irma Archuleta and Merry TaheriPUBLIC COMMENT  (5:35 PM)Alejandra Alvarez spoke.Commissioner McNinch spoke.Chair Soto spoke.Daniela Alvarez spoke.Maria Haro spoke.RECOGNITION OF CPCC COMMISSIONERS  (5:49 PM)Patrick Weithers, Manager of the CPCC, spoke.MANAGER'S REPORT  (5:53 PM)Patrick Weithers, Manager of the CPCC, spoke; and provided the Manager's Report.Francine Kerridge, Director of Police Oversight, spoke.Commander LeBaron spoke.REMARKS FROM CHAIR AND COMMISSIONERS  (5:59 PM)Commissioner McNinch spoke.Commissioner Garcia spoke.Page 2 of 6411 W. OCEAN BOULEVARDCIVIC CHAMBERS, 5:30 PMWEDNESDAY, OCTOBER 18, 2023CITY OF LONG BEACHCITIZEN POLICE COMPLAINT COMMISSION MINUTESCommissioner Ochoa spoke.Commissioner Walmsley spoke.Commissioner Fletcher spoke.Chair Soto spoke.RECESS TO CLOSED SESSION  (6:13 PM)At 6:13 PM, there being no objection, Chair Soto recessed the meeting to Closed Session.RECONVENE FROM CLOSED SESSION  (8:51 PM)At 8:51 PM, Chair Soto reconvened the meeting.ROLL CALL  (8:51 PM)Desmond Fletcher, Veronica Garcia, David Ochoa, Dianne McNinch, Kenneth Shiozaki-Kawamoto, Rocio Torres, Brent Walmsley and Michael Soto   Commissioners Present:Michele Anderson, Irma Archuleta and Merry Taheri   Commissioners Absent:2.

23-042CP.summary: Recommendation to receive Commission's vote and refer findings to the City Manager.Chair Soto reported out from Closed Session the following actions taken:[1] Case 22-168 Commissioners voted 4-3-1 on Allegation No. 1 -  Unbecoming Conduct for Officer accused;[2] Case No. 22-165 Commissioners voted 8-0 on Allegation Nos. 1 - Improper Detention, 2 - Use of Force, 3 - Unbecoming Conduct, and 4 - Unbecoming Conduct for Long Beach Police Department;[3] Case No. 22-169 Commissioners voted 8-0 on Allegation Nos. 1 - Unbecoming Conduct, 2 - Unbecoming Conduct, 3 - Unbecoming Page 3 of 6411 W. OCEAN BOULEVARDCIVIC CHAMBERS, 5:30 PMWEDNESDAY, OCTOBER 18, 2023CITY OF LONG BEACHCITIZEN POLICE COMPLAINT COMMISSION MINUTESConduct, 4 - Failure to Investigate, and 5 - Unbecoming Conduct for Officer accused;[4] Case No. 22-176 Commissioners voted 8-0 on Allegation Nos. 1 - Unbecoming Conduct, 2 - Unbecoming Conduct, 3 - Use of Force, and 4 -  Unbecoming Conduct for Officer accused;[5] Case No. 22-175 Commissioners voted 8-0 on Allegation Nos. 1 - Unbecoming Conduct, 2 - Unbecoming Conduct for Officer accused, and 3 - Failure to Investigate for Long Beach Police Department;[6] Case No. 22-171 Commissioners voted 6-2 on Allegation Nos. 1 - Failure to Take Action, 2 - Improper Arrest, and 3 - Unbecoming Conduct for Long Beach Police Department;[7] Case No. 22-174 Commissioners voted 5-3 on Allegation No. 1 - Unbecoming Conduct and 8-0 on Allegation No. 2 - Unbecoming Conduct for Officer accused;[8] Case No. 22-167 Commissioners voted 6-1-1 on Allegation No. 1 - Sexual Misconduct and 7-1 on Allegation No. 2 - Failure to Take Action for Officer accused;[9] Case No. 22-170 Commissioners voted 7-1 on Allegation No. 1 - Failure to Take Action for Long Beach Police Department;[10] Case No. 22-162 Commissioners voted 8-0 on Allegation No. 1 - Misappropriation of Property for Officer accused;[11] Case No. 22-173 Commissioners voted 8-0 on Allegation No. 1 - Failure to Take Action for First, Second, and Third Officers accused; [12] Case No. 22-172 Commissioners voted 8-0 on Allegation No. 1 - Unbecoming Conduct for First and Second Officers accused; and[13] Case No. 22-166 Commissioners voted 8-0 on Allegation No. 1 - Unbecoming Conduct for First and Second Officers accused.Page 4 of 6411 W. OCEAN BOULEVARDCIVIC CHAMBERS, 5:30 PMWEDNESDAY, OCTOBER 18, 2023CITY OF LONG BEACHCITIZEN POLICE COMPLAINT COMMISSION MINUTESA motion was made by Commissioner Ochoa, seconded by Commissioner Torres, to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 8 - Desmond Fletcher, Veronica Garcia, David Ochoa, Dianne McNinch, Kenneth Shiozaki-Kawamoto, Rocio Torres, Brent Walmsley and Michael SotoAbsent: 3 - Michele Anderson, Irma Archuleta and Merry Taheri3.
